reviewText: It's a good dvd the instructor is really talented and explains thing really great. It is good for someone in school or is thinking on becoming a esthetician

Learning the basics of European facials in the first volume of this DVD was very educational, so I decided to check out the second educational training video in this series.

I found volume 2 to be just as helpful as volume 1. This video covers the exfoliation techniques typical of a traditional European Massage procedure using enzymes, as well as many of the facial and neck massage techniques that expand to the shoulders, decollete, and arms. Learning these massage methods was a great benefit to me (well, mostly to my clients!) in providing an authentic European massage that is enjoyable and accurate in terms of what it is supposed to be. Getting the right techniques down was really important to me.

This company really produces some of the best training DVDs out there. I feel as though they really thought about how to explain things in the most educational and helpful way. I've learned a lot from these videos that was left out in my cosmetology training. I would definitely recommend this series to anyone looking to build a solid knowledge base.

I recently purchased the three part series (volume 1,2 and 3) of the European facials as continuing education. I was very impressed with how thorough and informative These videos were. Rita Page took her time explaining and demonstrated great step by step techniques. I learned a lot and I would definitely recommend these videos to all new estheticians! They've been a great help to me.
SIMPLY THE BEST FACIAL DVD I EVER SEEN, BUT YOU HAVE TO SEE VOL.1 THROUGH VOL.3, ALMOST 5HRS.
